# Java Basics

## Variables

The Java programming language defines the following **kinds of variables**:

* ***Instance Variables*** (Non-Static Fields) their values are unique to each instance of a class (to each object, in other words).

* ***Class Variables*** (Static Fields) this tells the compiler that there is exactly one copy of this variable in existence, regardless of how many times the class has been instantiated.

* ***Local Variables*** Similar to how an object stores its state in fields, a method will often store its temporary state in local variables. they are not accessible from the rest of the class.

* ***Parameters*** YRecall that the signature for the main method is public static void main(String[] args). parameters are always classified as "variables" not "fields". 

**Naming**
- case-sensitive. 
- Subsequent characters may be letters, digits, dollar signs, or underscore characters.

## compile code
the compilor (usually another program) takes the program the human wrote, and converts it into the program the computer can understand.
